name: Path N Urethra
title: Pathologic N
notes:
**Note 1:** Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS, in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in distant metastasis.

**Note 2:** Regional nodes include bilateral and contralateral involvement of named nodes.

**Note 3:** Size of lymph nodes must be known to assign N. You may use a physicianâs statement of the N category if this is the only information in the medical record. If the size of the lymph node(s) is not known, assign N1. 

**Note 4:** Determine the size of the largest metastasis in a lymph node as documented in the pathology report to N, not the size of the lymph node itself. If the size of the metastasis is not documented, determine the size of the largest involved lymph node as documented pathologically or clinically with pathology taking priority. Do not code the size of any node(s) coded in distant metastasis.
rows: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

Surgical resection of primary and pathologic assessment of regional nodes are done but involvement of regional nodes not stated
Surgical resection of primary and pathologic assessment of regional nodes are done but involvement of regional nodes not documented in patient record
Metastasis in a single lymph node 2 cm or less in greatest dimension

SINGLE regional lymph node, less than or equal to 2 cm:
    Iliac, NOS:
        Common
        External
        Internal (hypogastric), NOS:
            Obturator
    Inguinal, NOS:
        Deep inguinal, NOS
            Node of Cloquet or Rosenmuller (highest deep inguinal)
        Superficial (femoral)
    Pelvic, NOS
    Sacral, NOS
        Presacral

Size and/or number positive lymph nodes not stated

Regional lymph node, NOS
Lymph nodes, NOS

Stated as N1
Metastasis in a single lymph node more than 2 cm in greatest dimension, or in multiple lymph nodes

SINGLE regional lymph node greater than 2 cm OR 
MULTIPLE positive regional lymph nodes  

Stated as N2
Clinically no nodes positive and no pathologic evaluation of nodes
In situ case as defined by TNM and there is a resection of the primary but the nodes are not evaluated pathologically
Pathologic N is not defined for the specific site/histology

No pathologic evaluation of regional lymph nodes and case is not in situ
Regional lymph node(s) cannot be assessed pathologically
No resection of a known primary (not T0)
No surgical resection of primary tumor and no positive biopsy of the highest N 
Unknown if any pathologic assessment performed
